Food was delish. Service & portions was great. Yes i will go back & if ur in the neigborhood stop by. Call to RSVP
Classic Old School Brooklyn Italian neighborhood restaurant,  food was very good and good sized portions , service was very good and friendly.

Went to dinner with the wife tonight, food was amazing.. again! The usual Italian staples you're used to, but brought to a whole other level. Everything is cooked to order and doesn't disappoint, you can immediately taste the difference. Tommy and Brian are killing it. This place is going to explode. Can't reccomend enough. Don't be in a rush and enjoy a real Brooklyn meal.
Food was delish.  How I never noticed this place in the 40+ years I was in sunset park.
OMG Delicious food.
Hands down the best Italian food in Brooklyn and possibly all of NYC. My new go to place for sure.
Home made Italian! It is a must have.
(Translated by Google) I like it  (Original) Me gusta

We ordered dinner to be delivered and it was the best!  The delivery was right on time, and the food was delicious!  Huge portions, seem like family style portions, reasonably priced. We had spaghetti all’amatriciana, chicken Marsala, asparagus and beet salad.  All very tasty and nicely presented, even for take out.  The food arrived hot and with delicious Italian bread too!  I hope to go in person soon to try more menu items!
Awesome food!!!! Amazing!!! Everything delicious and definitely returning next time in time!! Bravo to the chef! Don’t hesitate to come here to eat, won’t be dissatisfied 👌❤️

I had heard many people talk about this establishment, and not in a bad or ill way. I decided to give it a try with a very good friend of mine. We picked Valentines day. Let me tell you, we were very surprised... everything we heard was not even close.. it was a fantastic experience. Me, that was in the food industry for a few years, and very critical of food venues, was pleasantly surprised. There is only a beer and wine license, which is fine by me. Also, the open kitchen was a pleasure to see. The cleanliness here is top notch. I ordered for an appetizer the MOZZARELLA EN CARROZZA, I use upper case for a reason. The quality was one of the best that I have eaten. The size was tremendous! It made French Toast look small! A meal onto itself, and superb flavor. My entrée was Veal Marsala, prepared perfectly. I had to take half of it home, so much I couldn't finish it. I will be returning here again very soon. I have also recommended this venue to many friends. I wish the staff here all the best and I will see them soon.

Not only is this the best Italian restaurant in Sunset Park, it’s one of the best in the city. I’ve never found a restaurant that makes chicken Marsala as good as mine but these guys make it BETTER! Amazing food, old school authentic vibes and fresh ingredients. Plus they always keep it interesting by adding new specials to the menu. If you haven’t eaten here you’re missing out
Such amazing delicious food! Service was great. We had eggplant parm, chicken piccata, penne vodka and pasta carbonara. Definitely worth it!!

This place is amazing! I have no photos to share because we scarfed it all down. This is highly quality Italian America cuisine, and it’s delicious. We got the penne vodka, spaghetti al amatriciana, veal Francese, and eggplant rollatini, plus tiramisu and bread pudding dessert. We got it delivery and it was packaged well. We hope to be able to eat in their restaurant soon!
(Translated by Google) The food is very good  (Original) La comida es muy buena
Best Italian food in Brooklyn!
Definitely coming back here.....this spot was welcoming inside my belly and out lol
Delicious food. Especially in a neighborhood where good Italian food is scarce.
Great food! Must try for great italian food!
Best italian restaurant in the area. All made from scratch.
No leftovers here! Best chicken marsala I've ever had!
Best Italian Food anywhere around hands down everything is amazing from these guys  anything you order is a 10 outta 10 chicken Marsala best I ever had
The best food in Brooklyn

We catered a customized Thanksgiving meal. Tommy the chef and owner is such a pleasure. My family had very high expectations and we are not easy to satisfy and let me tell you that each and every one was met. Every single dish was fantastic. We were blown away!!!!!!! This is the real deal for old school authentic Italian American food with amazing flavor.

WOW... This Place Is Amazing ..! Just Ordered For Thanksgiving Where Do We Start.. #1 You Can Taste The Freshness Of All The Ingredients With Your First Bite..! #2 The Portions Are  Huge & Delicious #3 Super Staff Who Are Very Knowledgeable & Will Help You Make A Successful Get together YOU WILL ❤ THE FOOD..!

Ok, I was invited by a few friends who go there. They know I'm a huge fan of chicken marsala, and have it in tons of restaurants all over ny, nj etc.. .and by far this place made me look at this dish in a whole nother light! The sauce was amazing and sweet, never like I have had it before. Topped with amazing garnishes that I will not expose because I want you to go there and see for yourself. But wait it doesn't end there, the chef/owners were amazing, friendly and more than attentive, the prices were more than fair. We had the bread pudding for desert and it was amazing and highly recommended.  I dont go to Brooklyn often anymore but this place is worth the trip and I will be back to take more pictures for you all.
Never a bad meal.  If you want some good Italian food YOU can't go wrong with amazing Chicken Marsala,  stuffed mushrooms ! GO!

Best Italian kitchen ever tasted. Everything is super fresh, I’m vegetarian and they have plenty of options: burrata is amazing, eggplant parmigiana is super tasty, arancini, asparagus, potatoes you name it ! Focaccia, mozzarella in carrozza was unbelievable, any pasta oh my god !!!
His prices move higher and faster than anything else his food is good but you can't raise a price for $5 in a matter of weeks. I've eaten there several times this will be the last
Excellent! Reminds me of my Grandma's cooking.
Good food
My friend and I just had dinner there this evening and he wasn't kidding about the food. Oh my everything we had was delicious I met the owners Brian and Tommy and they were dynamite.

What can I say im so impressed. Moved out of bk 3 years ago try to come back at least once a year to have my fav foods. Italian was one since my old fav place closed down. I found this gem. To start customer service on the phone was great to the way the food was delivered and packaged to the sweet delivery man. The mussels to die for so FRESH and flavorful, the penne vodka was just perfect, chicken milanese OMG huge portion and i could eat that meal everyday chicken perfectly cooked the arugula with a lemon dressing WOW. I ordered a plain pasta garlic and oil to say the flavor was no plain pasta thats for sure. I hope this place stays in business and continues to thrive with the help of the community because this place is so worth having in sunset park. I will definitely be eating again every time i visit. Out of this world amazing Italian food.
Food is always good here.

The food here was amazing with nice sized portions.  We really enjoyed meeting the chef and it was great to see the pride he took in the restaurant. It is clear this is a labor of love and we can't wait to go back and support them!

If you want REAL GOOD Italian food, this is the place to go to!!!! This place just opened June 2020 and it’s amazing!  Only tried 3 dishes, but each dish was super flavorful and absolutely delicious.  We started off with the sausage stuffed baby Bella mushrooms. They were bomb! I ordered the linguine with clams in white sauce, and my friend ordered the spaghetti all’amatriciana. Wow, just wow. I loved my linguine with clams and I tried a bit of my friends spaghetti, and it was super tasty!  It’s been a while since I had some amazing Italian food, and Brooklyn Roots definitely had it all. I can’t wait to come back and try other dishes!  Oh yea, and then I went around the corner to their ice shop and got some coquito ices. Great way to end dinner!  Love love love! Thank you!
Excellent place in the heart of Sunset Park! Amazing food a great customer service, highly recommended.

Outrageously good! The sauce is incredible, and the chicken parm is enough to feed a small army. I had been eagerly anticipating stopping by for a while, and I was not disappointed. Highly, highly recommended. I can't shut up about this place!
(Translated by Google) Very good  (Original) Muy bien

This food is wonderful. We tried it for the first time tonight and I can't wait to order again! It's straightforward and clearly cooked with care. The flavors have depth without being complicated. Simply delicious. Italian restaurants are a dime a dozen in Brooklyn,  but this one stands out. Well done Brooklyn Roots NYC!
“ Old school” dishes right on the money, all 7 of us left happy & full!

I tried Brooklyn Roots for the first time and it was delightful. Not to mention there was only one guy in the kitchen making it all. The portions are huge so you definitely get your money’s worth.  Great flavors, fresh and totally authentic Italian. They also have a homemade ice cream shop around the block.  I’ll be back
Sauce was very good. Chicken Scarparello was dry.
Food was  just like grandmas had eggplant parmigiana with a side of pasta. Homemade coconut ice cream will be back!
**Ordered takeout during COVID pandemic  Food *Complimentary half loaf of Italian bread *Pan fried meatballs - good (appetizer size; topped with ricotta and tomato sauce) *Penne vodka - good

An all around amazing experience. Both the food and the service was authentic! We had the ribeye—the rub they use is SO TASTY and it was cooked perfectly— and the Lobster Pasta with rose sauce which was DIVINE! Staff is so down to earth and friendly. Nonna’s around the world should be proud of this lil joint. Can’t wait to go back!
Delicious food & dessert. Large portions. Great friendly service. Will definitely be back!
Food was so good. Friendly staff. A little pricey but worth it❤
Amazing !
Food was incredible best pasta place in the neighborhood!!!

So, every once in awhile you're lucky enough to stumble across a true gem of a place where the food is ridiculously scrumptious but the people and the energy within the establishment make you feel as if you've been there one thousand times over.  It's a restaurant that pulls you in, makes you want to stay and gain about twenty pounds in the process.  Do yourselves a favor and order everything. Mussels like I've never had before, Marsala to swim in, perfect baked clams, the best broccoli rabe ever, Sunday sauce which passes as your own and the most amazing daily specials. Oh, and the chef is insane  =)  Just go.

Food is absolutely amazing, the atmosphere is very old School hangout place.  Thomas the chef is INSANE and does everything himself.  Some of the best food I’ve ever had.  The chicken Marsala is easily one of my favorite dishes.
Excellent food, a great overall experience
Food was excellent. Generous portions and traditional flavors were on point. Great service as well!

I was there yesterday with a couple of friends. The level of hospitality was unparalleled. The food was really good. I ordered the chicken parm with pasta, and loved it. Shout out to Brian for making it a wonderful experience.
Great food!  Came quickly, prepared to perfection and good size portions. Looking forward to ordering from Brooklyn Roots again!
Excellent Food!!

Great hospitality! Stopped in on my way to Manhattan (close to the subway) because I had to do some work. Staff was friendly. Inexpensive drinks (ordered a glass of house red wine) and a surprise slice of pizza that was great! Highly recommend this neighborhood joint.

Love this local spot! The owner is usually around and makes sure you feel at home and get the best service.  I am partial to the chicken parm, it’s big enough to share but it’s so good I tend to hoard the whole thing.
Great atmosphere authentic Italian food and great staff  I recommend this cafe to anyone that wants good quality food and great customer service 😁.

Was a hair in my food. Paid in cash so no way to get a refund. Never go there and will not go back.  Thank you for your response it is so nice to see that you care. I will be honest with you- I paid in cash and it’s a far drive from me to come back to get a refund and at this point that is what I would like. I’m not sure what you typically do in situations like these because given how nicely you responded I’d love to change the review.
We had an interesting time here, the service was okay but im not sure we would go back again
Wonderful place. Great vibe. Terrific menu.  A must try for anyone in the area.
Food is great. Nice atmosphere and good place  to visit...
Nice neighborhood place. Good food.

The food is great. The owner cooks delicious.
Great food !! People !!! Atmosphere and music💕💜💜💜
Nice place, service, food & some nights live music.
Bad....

Café Lore sits on the corner of 46th Street and 4th Avenue in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn. I came for dinner on a weekday evening. The two guys who own the place are charming and friendly. If you ask, they'll tell you stories about the neighborhood, the tragedy of how the Gowanus expressway divided the neighborhood, and what it was like for their family through the generations - they've been in the neighborhood since 1902! Ask for the mozzarella sticks - they're fresh. And the boys serve up their own homemade fresh ice cream.
Good food and the service was excellent. It's a tiny restaurant and it takes a little while for the food to be ready but it's worth it.
Good food
Tasty fresh and delicious
(Translated by Google) A cozy place good food and attention  (Original) Un lugar acogedor buena comida y atención
Good place from what I heard nice treat, good environment and amazing food. My mother don't lie.
A really authentic place with homemade food.
fantastic!!! nex time I'll tell Brian I was there!! ciao!!You do a good job!!! Your mother & father will be pride of you!!!    My very best,  anita garavelli
one of the few good places in the neighborhood plus LIFE MUSIC as well. food is home made.

This place reminds me of going to your single uncle's house for dinner. There are all the basics necessities: tables, silverware, chairs, kitchen, maybe a bathroom and of course, your uncle running a one man show dressed in a t-shirt and basketball shorts. Needless to say, the dress is casual. The decor is pretty basic and there is a piano as well as some guitars when the band comes to play.  Customer service reflects being treated like family. Although the customer service was great, what really blew me away was the food that came out of this small kitchen! TOP OF THE LINE stuff for sure. Everything made fresh and from scratch. Quality of food is definitely something that is valued here. We ordered the New York Classic Chicken with marinara and Chicken Alfredo. The portions are large! We also ordered a personal pan deep dish pizza as a starter. None of the food disappointed. Everything was delicious!  Expect to pay for quality though - $51 for the three dishes that could easily be shared. My date and I had plenty of leftovers to take with us. Well worth it!
